rules.natural: Provided that patient1 adheres to the protocol, if the treatment in trial1 is not effective, then patient1 shows abstinence.
If researcher1 is blinded as an investigator, then whenever patient1 attends the study visits, patient1 adheres to the protocol.
Either researcher1 is blinded as an investigator or nurse1 is blinded as a coordinator.
If nurse1 is blinded as a coordinator, then given that patient1 attends the study visits, patient1 adheres to the protocol.
A protocol violation occurs in trial1, or the data for trial1 is audited, or the treatment in trial1 is effective.
Provided that monitor1 conducts monitoring for trial1, a protocol violation does not occur in trial1.
Monitor1 conducts monitoring for trial1, or statistician1 performs an interim analysis for trial1.
If the ethics board (IRB) approves trial1, then the agency (FDA) approves trial1.
If the ethics board (IRB) approves trial1, then committee1 (DSMB) reviews trial1.
If the agency (FDA) approves trial1, then provided that it is not the case that 'if an interim analysis is performed, then a protocol violation does not occur', trial1 is not halted.
If craving is reduced for patient1, then the treatment in trial1 is effective.
Provided that consumption is decreased for patient1, the treatment in trial1 is effective.
If patient1 receives an intervention, then craving is reduced for patient1.
Under the condition that patient1 gets support, consumption is decreased for patient1.
If patient1 meets the secondary endpoint, then patient1 receives an intervention or gets support.
If a paper for trial1 is published in journal1, then given that statistical significance is reached, if patient1 meets the primary endpoint, patient1 meets the secondary endpoint.
A paper for trial1 is published in journal1, or the results of trial1 are presented at conference1.

If the results of trial1 are presented at conference1, then under the condition that statistical significance is reached, if patient1 meets the primary endpoint, patient1 meets the secondary endpoint.
Provided that a biological sample (blood) is collected from patient1, the treatment in trial1 is effective.

Whenever the European agency (EMA) reviews trial1, then if it is not the case that 'if patient1 has a poor metabolizer status, then a pharmacogenetic response occurs', the dose for patient1 is adjusted.
If patient1 uses a diary, then if the treatment in trial1 is not effective, patient1 shows abstinence.
Patient1 uses a diary, or patient1 wears a sensor.
If patient1 receives a placebo, then whenever patient1 reports a headache as an adverse event, patient1 does not experience nausea as a side effect.
If patient1 completes the AUDIT-C questionnaire, then data is not missing for patient1.
Under the condition that clinician1 conducts an interview with patient1, data is not missing for patient1.
Grant1 funding is continued, or patient1 completes the AUDIT-C questionnaire, or clinician1 conducts an interview with patient1.

If the protocol for trial1 is amended to version2, then given that committee1 (DSMB) reviews trial1, if it is not the case that 'if an interim analysis is performed, then a protocol violation does not occur', trial1 is not halted.
Trial1 undergoes a multicenter expansion, or if the protocol for trial1 is not amended to version2, then recruitment for trial1 is paused.
Patient1 completes the 6-month follow-up, or long-term data is collected from patient1 at year1.
If long-term data is collected from patient1 at year1, then whenever patient1 meets the primary endpoint, patient1 receives an intervention or gets support.
Replication study trial2 is initiated, or if patient1 completes the 6-month follow-up, then given that patient1 meets the primary endpoint, patient1 receives an intervention or gets support.
Patient1 has a contraindication (a liver condition), or if patient1 is randomized into groupA, then patient1 receives a placebo.
If patient1 takes the study drug, naltrexone, then patient1 attends the study visits.
Patient1 takes the study drug, naltrexone, or patient1 receives counseling.
Under the condition that patient1 receives counseling, if the treatment in trial1 is not effective, then patient1 shows abstinence.
If it is not the case that 'if patient1 completes trial1, then the treatment is effective', then patient1 experiences nausea as a side effect.
Provided that it is not the case that 'if patient1 completes trial1, then the treatment is effective', patient1 reports a headache as an adverse event.
Whenever it is not the case that 'if an interim analysis is performed, then a protocol violation does not occur', trial1 is halted.
Under the condition that it is not the case that 'if patient1 wears a sensor, then if the treatment is not effective, patient1 shows abstinence', data is missing for patient1.
